item.title: Police release footage of triple murder suspect as commissioner calls DV a scourge on the community
item.description: The NSW Police commissioner says a surge in domestic violence attacks is a disgrace as police release footage of Julian Ingram, the main suspect wanted over the deadly Lake Cargelligo shooting.

item.title: Coalition chaos drags on ahead of first official sitting week
item.description: Former prime minister John Howard once observed that Pauline Hanson was an "electoral gift to the Labor Party". His words proved relevant this week as the Coalition's chaos dragged on.

item.title: Hastie and Taylor fail to agree on plan to oust Ley despite clandestine meeting
item.description: The two conservative men vying to replace Sussan Ley as leader of the Liberal Party met in Melbourne before attending a memorial service for their former colleague Katie Allen.

item.title: Parramatta provided with emails from Zac Lomax's lawyer as contract drama plays out in court
item.description: Parramatta has been given nine emails sent by Zac Lomax's lawyer as the case between the former Eels winger and his former club prepares to hit the courtroom.

item.title: How farmers help keep their livestock and produce alive during a heatwave
item.description: How farmers make sure their livestock — and produce — stay safe during a heatwave.

item.title: Most AI assistants are feminine — and it's fuelling dangerous stereotypes and abuse
item.description: The design choices behind AI technologies — female voices, deferential responses, playful deflections — create a permissive environment for gendered aggression.

item.title: Queensland farm cashing in on US wellness industry demand for camel milk
item.description: Camel milk is in hot demand in the wellness industry, now one Queensland farmer is seizing the moment.

item.title: Adelaide man's homemade steam locomotive to haul tourists after 23-year passion build
item.description: After initially waking in a "cold sweat" over the enormity of what he had taken on, Ironbank's Glen Smythe can finally relax after finishing his homemade locomotive — although he still has the boiler to build.

item.title: Planning to breastfeed? Preparation can help you meet your goals
item.description: While most mothers in Australia start breastfeeding, by the time babies are five months old, exclusive breastfeeding drops to 15 per cent. Knowing what to expect — before bub is born — can increase the chances of meeting your breastfeeding goals.

item.title: Two arrested after allegedly stolen vehicle is driven at police in Geelong
item.description: Two arrests have been made after police shot at an allegedly stolen car that collided with a school bus before driving towards officers in Geelong.

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Tennis Australia boss Craig Tiley listening to Coco Gauff player privacy complaints
item.description: The Australian Open will listen to complaints from players like Coco Gauff about behind-the-scenes cameras but remain convinced of their value, Tennis Australia chief executive Craig Tiley says.

item.title: Canadian backpacker Piper James's family and friends to visit Australia
item.description: The heartbroken parents of Canadian backpacker Piper James will travel to Australia next week to visit K'gari, the island where their beloved daughter lost her life.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: 'Never seen magnitude' of foreign vessels in Far North Queensland, as government defends border security
item.description: Torres Strait Island leaders say federal government claims of strong border protections do not match what communities are seeing on their doorstep in Queensland's far north.

item.title: Bluey tops streaming charts in US for second year running
item.description: Americans tuned in to watch 45.2 billion minutes of Bluey, Bingo, Bandit and Chilli last year.

item.title: Democrats strike funding deal with White House as Trump undercuts border tsar on Minnesota drawdown
item.description: Donald Trump says he has struck a deal with Congressional Democrats to temporarily fund the Department of Homeland Security, heading off a political brawl that seemed inevitable after the Senate voted down the latest package of government spending bills.

item.title: EU labels Iran's Revolutionary Guards a terrorist organisation in policy shift
item.description: European Union foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas says "repression cannot go unanswered" as the bloc looks set to categorise the IRGC alongside Islamic State and Al Qaeda.

item.title: What could have happened to Celine Cremer, the Belgian tourist who went missing in Tasmania in 2023?
item.description: Celine Cremer went missing in 2023 from a track in a remote part of Tasmania's north-west. With several recent discoveries in the area, these are the theories of what could have happened.

item.title: Trump says Putin agrees not to fire on Kyiv for one week, as freezing cold grips Ukraine
item.description: Ukrainians, including residents of the country's capital, are experiencing their toughest winter of the war as Russian attacks target electricity infrastructure.

item.title: February interest rate rise will be a 'bitter pill' for those struggling with cost of living, advocates say
item.description: Consumer advocates fear a rate hike when the RBA board meets next week could be the "straw that breaks the camel's back" for borrowers in mortgage stress.

item.title: GPS trackers in e-waste from Australia reveal 'likely' illegal exports to South-East Asia
item.description: A not-for-profit environmental group put GPS devices in 35 e-waste items and dropped them off at recycling locations in four Australian capital cities. Here's what they found.

item.title: The curious case of Pritam Singh, Singapore's ousted opposition leader
item.description: Even for a de facto one-party state, the ruling People's Action Party's decision to dictate who runs Singapore's opposition is remarkable.

item.title: Novak Djokovic feels disrespected ahead of Australian Open semi against Jannik Sinner
item.description: Playing with a chip on his shoulder or feeling slighted is often when 10-time Australian Open champion Novak Djokovic produces his best results.

item.title: As Donald Trump weighs up actions, Iranians send the US a message to 'please help'
item.description: Protesters in Iran are begging US President Donald Trump to launch military action to help topple the Islamic regime. But could it happen?

item.title: Two aspirants who are unlikely to suit the times vie for Liberal leadership
item.description: Andrew Hastie and Angus Taylor both want to run against Sussan Ley. But the two right-wingers cannot afford to split the conservative vote on which their tilts would rely.

item.title: Elena Rybakina takes the long road back into Australian Open final and best in the world conversation
item.description: After being the forgotten figure when it comes to conversations about elite women's players, Elena Rybakina has put her name back up in lights.

item.title: Adelaide median house price grows $50,000 in a quarter, reaching $925,000 according to Valuer-General data
item.description: Experts are forecasting continued growth this year as Adelaide's metropolitan median house sale price inches closer to $1 million, according to Valuer-General data.

item.title: The makers of AACTA-nominated movies and TV shows discuss the Australian screen industry
item.description: Ahead of next week's AACTA Awards, the makers of frontrunners Bring Her Back, Kangaroo and Apple Cider Vinegar share their thoughts on the state of the local screen industry.

item.title: Queensland Police refuse to release report following review into treatment of women in State Emergency Service
item.description: The ABC understands that some female volunteers aired allegations of sexism and discrimination as part of the review, which was undertaken in early 2024.

item.title: A mid-match coffee break, Aryna Sabalenka's hindrance and a finalist's flashback — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka's abnormal sound is punished, an Aussie has a mid-match coffee break and a women's finalist has an unsettling flashback. Here are the quick hits from day 12 at the Australian Open.

item.title: Shoppers remember 'old days' at grocery store that has operated since late 19th century
item.description: A New South Wales grocery store has been operating since before there was refrigeration, electricity and even Vegemite.

item.title: Hastie says he doesn't have support to challenge for Liberal leadership — as it happened
item.description: Andrew Hastie will not contest the Liberal leadership, clearing the way for a possible challenge to Sussan Ley from Angus Taylor.

item.title: Trump tariffs could 'isolate' the US and create new trading blocs
item.description: In the past fortnight, US President Donald Trump has threatened tariffs against at least 10 countries. Some experts say the Trump administration's tariff policy is leading to the creation of new trading blocs, and isolating the United States.

item.title: Gold, silver plummet ahead of Fed chair announcement — as it happened
item.description: The prices of gold and silver have plummeted in Asian trade as markets prepare for a surprise Federal Reserve announcement, and the ASX 200 has finished the week on a negative note. Look back on the day's finance news in our business blog.

item.title: Thousands of flying foxes die, hundreds rescued, amid record-breaking SA heatwaves
item.description: A deadly combination of heatwaves has all but decimated a colony of flying foxes in SA's south-east, with surviving bats taken in by conservationists.

item.title: SA Arts Minister Andrea Michaels to quit politics after state election
item.description: Andrea Michaels will not recontest her seat of Enfield, in Adelaide's inner north, but will remain in the cabinet until the March election.

item.title: Inpex under investigation after suspected sulphur dioxide exposure leaves worker in hospital
item.description: The Australian Workers' Union has raised concerns after a worker at Inpex's Ichthys gas facility was allegedly exposed to sulphur dioxide and hospitalised, prompting an investigation by the NT workplace safety watchdog.

item.title: Australian Defence Force member charged over army truck crash north-west of Brisbane
item.description: Police charge the 25-year-old over the collision, which left a woman in hospital.

item.title: Pakistan down Australia by 22 runs in first match of T20 World Cup warm up series
item.description: Despite the best efforts of evergreen spinner Adam Zampa, Australia have suffered a 22-run defeat to Pakistan in the first T20 of their World Cup preparations.

item.title: From Bondi to Perth, questions are being raised about the safety of public events
item.description: As the Invasion Day rally incident and Bondi terror attack shatter expectations that people should be able to gather peacefully in public places, Australians may be facing a new normal.

item.title: WA heatwave causes almost $1 million in crop losses to Gascoyne fruitgrowers
item.description: Growers in WA's Gascoyne food bowl have lost an estimated $1 million of fruit, with another heatwave on the way.

item.title: Genetically modified purple tomatoes bound for fruit shops after regulator approval
item.description: The purple tomato was altered to make it taste better and boost nutrition.

item.title: Polar bear walks on ice with cubs
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: 'Good news' for Norway's polar bears, which are growing fatter despite loss of sea ice
item.description: Polar bears of the Svalbard archipelago have surprised scientists by growing fatter, despite shrinking sea ice, with one theory that the bears are including reindeer and walrus in their diet.

item.title: Teenage bushwalker found dead in the Blue Gum Forest in Blue Mountains National Park
item.description: Police say the teen and his 17-year-old friend became separated after setting out on a three-day hike.

item.title: Kevin Muscat's Shanghai Port one of nine Chinese Super League clubs hit with corruption sanctions
item.description: Kevin Muscat's chances of steering Shanghai Port to a third successive Chinese Super League title have taken a hit with the club to start the season on minus five points after the Chinese FA completed a wide-ranging investigation into corruption.

item.title: Look back at historic V-Set passenger service
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: The US wants to control Venezuela's finances. These armed groups could make it difficult
item.description: The US plan to "recover" Venezuela could spark a domestic backlash in a country that is already heavily divided among various armed groups that have political interests.

item.title: Donald Trump has Iran in his sights, but what is his endgame?
item.description: As the "massive armada" of the United States approaches Iran to be in place for a possible military attack, a key question remains: what can such firepower actually achieve?

item.title: Brisbane Lions coach Chris Fagan says Lachie Neale having his 'best pre-season in a long time'
item.description: Lachie Neale has been in the spotlight all summer after giving up the Brisbane co-captaincy amid his highly-publicised marriage breakdown but the Lions brass believe the premiership winner is physically in the midst of his best pre-season in some years.

item.title: Djokovic, Alcaraz win epic five-setters to set up Australian Open final showdown
item.description: Novak Djokovic will face Carlos Alcaraz in the Australian Open men's singles final after winning another epic semifinal against Jannik Sinner.

item.title: Australia closely monitoring Nipah virus, no change to border control
item.description: The federal government is closely monitoring an outbreak of Nipah virus in India but has not received any advice to tighten border controls at this stage.

item.title: Sussan Ley issues ultimatum to David Littleproud as she announces temporary shadow ministry
item.description: The under-fire Liberal leader has given seven existing frontbenchers carriage of the portfolios vacated by Nationals, with a threat to leader David Littleproud the arrangements could be made permanent.

item.title: Nine Radio sold for cut-price $56m to pub tycoon Arthur Laundy as it spends $850m on outdoor ad company QMS
item.description: Arthur Laundy's Laundy Family Office acquires a network that includes Melbourne's top-rating talk station 3AW, Sydney's 2GB and outspoken conservative presenters such as Ben Fordham and Tom Elliott.

item.title: SA man arrested for allegedly lighting multiple fires during Riverland heatwave
item.description: A 49-year-old South Australian man has been arrested for allegedly lighting multiple fires in the state's Riverland.

item.title: Katarapko fire in South Australia's Riverland
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Donald Trump shares video of Alex Pretti confrontation with agents 11 days before shooting
item.description: United States President Donald Trump has shared a video on Truth Social showing Alex Pretti in a confrontation with federal immigration agents 11 days before the intensive care nurse was fatally shot during a separate encounter with Border Patrol agents.

item.title: Celine Cremer police search finds more human remains, jacket believed to belong to missing backpacker
item.description: More human remains and a jacket believed to belong to missing backpacker Celine Cremer have been found in a search of Tasmania's Arthur River, police say.

item.title: Adelaide Hills man completes 23-year steam locomotive build
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bruce Springsteen releases anti-ICE protest song Streets of Minneapolis
item.description: The Boss has blasted the Trump administration and ICE agents in a new song responding to "the state terror being visited" on Minneapolis and dedicated to Renee Good and Alex Pretti.

item.title: Government lands last-minute hospital funding deal with states
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bowed to mounting pressure from the states, promising an extra $25 billion for public hospitals.

item.title: Machine capable of making millions of illegal cigarettes seized in Sydney
item.description: A machine which can produce millions of black market cigarettes has been seized in a raid in north-west Sydney, as the fight against the illegal tobacco trade heats up.

item.title: Cannington greyhound racing 'carnage' prompts phase out calls
item.description: Four dogs were injured and two euthanased after a greyhound racing event in Cannington this week, escalating calls to end the sport.

item.title: 'Devastating tragedy': Perth family dead in suspected murder-suicide
item.description: WA Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide in suburban Perth after finding two teenage boys and two adults dead in a home in Mosman Park.

item.title: Charges laid after allegedly stolen vehicle crashes into Geelong school bus, officer opens fire
item.description: A 37-year-old man and a 43-year-old woman have been charged after a dramatic incident that saw police open fire at a vehicle that allegedly drove at officers after crashing into a bus on Thursday afternoon.

item.title: Families frayed by NDIS cuts brace for more change ahead of defining 2026
item.description: Families frayed by NDIS cuts are bracing for even more change ahead of a year that is set to reshape the scheme into something more sustainable, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

item.title: Fugees, Weezer, Spiderbait's classic albums turn 30 in 2026
item.description: From Weezer's raw emotion to the Spice Girls's pop revolution, revisit 10 iconic albums that made 1996 a landmark year in music. Thirty years on, they still define the era.

item.title: Why your sunscreen application might be putting your good intentions to waste
item.description: This is what three experts had to say about how to get the best protection from your sunscreen.

item.title: FBI seizes Georgia ballots as Trump pursues 2020 election grievance
item.description: Fulton County, which votes overwhelmingly Democratic, has been a target of President Donald Trump since he narrowly lost the 2020 presidential election in Georgia to Democrat Joe Biden.

item.title: New Zealand has refused to join Donald Trump's 'Board of Peace'. What about the rest of the world?
item.description: New Zealand has declined Donald Trump's invitation to join his Board of Peace and is calling for "clarity" over the proposal. Here's where other countries stand.

item.title: Hastie rules out challenge to Sussan Ley for Liberal Party leadership
item.description: The West Australian backbencher had made no secret of his desire to lead the Liberal Party but says he will not run against Sussan Ley next week, a move which could pave the way for Angus Taylor.

item.title: Tim Picton's brother says seeing CCTV would be 'scarring for me forever'
item.description: In his first interview since the death of his brother Tim, SA's Health Minister Chris Picton reflects on the profound emotional impact of the loss on their family, his reluctance to watch the CCTV footage, and his brother's inability to become an organ donor "because of the coronial process".

item.title: More than $370 million now allocated for Victorian bushfire recovery support
item.description: The state and federal governments will substantially increase financial support for 23 Victorian local government areas devastated by bushfires this month.

item.title: Gold and silver prices collapse ahead of announcement of new US Federal Reserve chair
item.description: Gold and silver prices have plummeted, sparked by reports US President Donald Trump is set to announce a new US Federal Reserve chair.

item.title: Albanese government urged to use careful diplomacy to defuse Darwin Port row with China
item.description: Industry groups that suffered three years of damaging Chinese trade tariffs on products including barley are appealing to the federal government to exercise careful diplomacy to defuse tensions with China over the ownership of Darwin Port.

item.title: Friday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Police investigating 'allegations involving a child' at Alice Springs childcare centre
item.description: The centre operator says staff have been stood down as police investigate an allegation made by the family of a child enrolled at one of its services.

item.title: Carlos Alcaraz downs Alexander Zverev in ultimate match of margins as Australian Open finally delivers epic
item.description: The margins can prove to be razor-thin when it comes to the business end of grand slam tournaments. Carlos Alcaraz and Alexander Zverev found out firsthand in an all-time classic.

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Alexander Zverev takes issue with Carlos Alcaraz's injury timeout during semifinal
item.description: Alexander Zverev says he "didn't like" that Carlos Alcaraz was allowed a medical timeout for a cramp during their semifinal match.

item.title: Donald Trump announces Kevin Warsh as next Fed chair, replacing Jerome Powell
item.description: Mr Warsh will replace current chair Jerome Powell when his term expires in May.

item.title: Former CNN anchor Don Lemon arrested on charges related to anti-ICE protest
item.description: The arrest comes after Don Lemon live-streamed a demonstration that interrupted a church service in St Paul, Minnesota, earlier this month while protesting against President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown in the area.

item.title: More than 3 million new 'Epstein files' released by US government
item.description: The US Department of Justice says it is releasing more than 3 million new documents from the "Epstein files", but Democrats question why millions more are being withheld.

item.title: Donald Trump's many foreign policy bluffs come at a political price
item.description: As the US president faces domestic consequences for his violent immigration crackdown, his geopolitical bluffs across the world also come at a price.

item.title: Taylor Liberals' leading man as leadership spill looms
item.description: One Liberal source told the ABC a challenge to Sussan Ley's leadership is now a "matter of when, not if".

item.title: Novak Djokovic hits out at critics after epic Australian Open win over Jannik Sinner
item.description: After beating two-time defending champion Jannik Sinner in five gruelling sets, Novak Djokovic sets his sights on those who doubted whether he could still be an Australian Open contender.

item.title: Children living in makeshift tents in Gaza are dying from hypothermia
item.description: Mohammed died from hypothermia while in his mother's arms after a cold night in Gaza. His family are one of hundreds of thousands of Gazans enduring harsh winter conditions in flimsy tents across the enclave.

item.title: Mimili artists talk of Country, community, survival in remote APY Lands
item.description: The artists of Mimili, in the APY Lands of South Australia, are using new methods to share crucial knowledge of Country and culture, including repurposed car parts.

item.title: Australia's solar panel waste is mounting. Will the government's recycling scheme solve it?
item.description: Australia is on the brink of a solar panel waste crisis. Experts say there's much to do before a national recycling program can stand on its own two feet.

item.title: Keith, Barry Hall and a c-bomb: How Playlunch tore through the 2025 Hottest 100
item.description: Keith, the incendiary single from Melbourne seven-piece Playlunch, has ripped through the hearts, minds and ears of fans around Australia and the world.

item.title: To understand Melania Trump's movie we might need to follow the money
item.description: Dire box office sales surrounding the US first lady's bio-doc have made headlines, but some argue there's likely a good reason Jeff Bezos's Amazon MGM Studios has splashed so much cash on MELANIA.

item.title: Catherine O'Hara from Home Alone and Schitt's Creek dies aged 71
item.description: The Canadian-born actress died at her home in Los Angeles at the age of 71 "following a brief illness", according to a statement from her agency.

item.title: Push for retailers to play role in 3D-printed gun crackdown after Bondi attack
item.description: Hardware stores would report customers suspected of building 3D-printed guns to the authorities under fresh calls for corporate Australia to play a role in thwarting access to the deadly weapons

item.title: Ensay's annual Mountain Calf Sale moved to Bairnsdale for animal welfare
item.description: The tiny Victorian town of Ensay has proudly hosted the annual mountain calf sale for decades, but the yards will be empty this year.

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Cramping Carlos causes controversy, an AO ultra marathon and Aussies win mixed doubles — quick hits from Melbourne Park
item.description: Gadecki and Peers make their own bit of history and "old man" Djokovic turns back the clock to reach his 11th Aussie final. Here are the quick hits from day 13 at the Australian Open.

item.title: Families continue fight for railway crossing upgrades 25 years after horror Gerogery fatalities
item.description: Barry Wooden has spent decades trying to honour the lives of his son and four mates who died in a horror railway crossing crash 25 years ago.

item.title: Crochet octopus toys bring tactile comfort to premature babies at Western Sydney NICUs
item.description: With materials, time and love, Bernice Joy Luxford has brought comfort to the sick infants and their emotionally and physically exhausted caregivers via over 700 octopus toys.

item.title: Beckham saga is an age-old heartache with an uncomfortably modern twist
item.description: Cutting ties with your parents isn't a new phenomenon but having it painstakingly documented across social media is a contemporary problem.

item.title: Celine Cremer case shows role of private investigators in helping families find answers
item.description: Facing extreme weather and limited resources, Tasmania Police had to stop its search for Celine Cremer. But with her disappearance unresolved, loved ones turned to a private investigator instead.

item.title: What we know about the suspected murder-suicide of a Perth family of four
item.description: An entire family has been found dead in their own home — a mother, a father and their two teenage boys, with police describing the event as "highly distressing" and a "devastating tragedy".

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka the Australian Open final favourite but Elena Rybakina pledges 'fight to the end'
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka and Elena Rybakina are poised for a heavyweight bout in the Australian Open women's singles final, a rematch of a the classic 2023 decider.

item.title: Much of Queensland set to sizzle ahead of cooler, wet change next week
item.description: The worst of the heat has moved into south-west Queensland, while temperatures in the south-east could still hit 40 degrees Celsius before a cooler change early next week.

item.title: It was an audacious idea for a Liberals-Greens government, but did anyone stop to ask what Canberra voters would think?
item.description: The idea of a coalition between the ACT Greens and the Canberra Liberals appears to be on hold for now — but a quick history lesson is important to understand how both sides were willing to consider it.

item.title: The tide takes away his work each day, but learning to let go has transformed this artist
item.description: Mal Leckie has spent every morning over the past 50 years at the beach, but when illness hurt his ability to surf, he had to find a new reason to get out of bed.

item.title: Ballroom community takes over State Library of Victoria for LGBTQIA+ Fantasy Ball
item.description: From a fairy-themed beginners' performance to the revered "sex siren" category, participants vied for 10s on a night celebrating queer and trans people of colour at the State Library of Victoria.

item.title: Ballroom performance at the State Library Victoria
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: This easy zucchini, corn and feta dish packs a punch - ABC News
item.description: With tender roasted zucchini, salty feta, charred sweet corn and crunchy seeds, this dish will satisfy a veggie craving and is the perfect balance of taste and texture.

item.title: Millions of dollars projected for flood-affected north-west Queensland graziers to rebuild
item.description: Graziers are looking at a tough few years and millions of dollars to restock cattle herds as recovery begins in outback Queensland after widespread flooding hit the north-west.

item.title: Fruit tree netting installations to increase over next decade as heatwaves persist
item.description: Sales of netting to protect fruit crops from extreme weather have increased in the past five years as researchers warn heatwaves will continue to impact agriculture.

item.title: Kakadu National Park's Jabiru Airport slated for demolition from October
item.description: Kakadu's main airport, which services a wide and remote corner of the Northern Territory, has been slated for demolition as the deadline for the nearby uranium mine's rehabilitation looms.

item.title: Kambalda's future unclear on 60th anniversary of nickel discovery
item.description: This week marks 60 years since one of Australia's biggest mineral discoveries put Kambalda on the map. But now all the WA town's nickel mines have closed and the prospect of a future restart is unclear.

item.title: Bruny Island to get childcare solution but too late for the Archers
item.description: After fighting for years for a childcare solution for her community, Teisha Archer says the news it will be happening is "wonderful" — but will come too late to help her and others in her situation.

item.title: Farmers reeling as estimated $20 million in livestock perish in Victorian fires
item.description: The fires wiped out swathes of farmland and killed tens of thousands of livestock.

item.title: As anger boiled over the Invasion Day rally bomb threat, some politicians were uncharacteristically silent
item.description: As more details about the explosive device in Perth's Invasion Day rally emerged, opposition leader Basil Zempilas has only given limited responses on the issue.

item.title: Prime minister and SA premier announce $800 million deal for 17,000 new homes
item.description: Funding for water infrastructure, urban renewal projects and first-home buyer schemes has been announced in a partnership between the Commonwealth and the state government.

item.title: Journalist Don Lemon charged with federal civil rights crimes over anti-ICE church protest
item.description: Former CNN news anchor Don Lemon enters a not guilty plea and is released from custody after being arrested during an anti-ICE protest he says he was covering as an independent journalist.

item.title: Darwin Lord Mayor Peter Styles says NT Electoral Commission lost his election donations disclosure information
item.description: Darwin's Lord Mayor, Peter Styles, says the Northern Territory Electoral Commission lost an envelope containing his campaign donations disclosure.

item.title: First Nations people say 'silence' on alleged Perth bomb attack weighs heavily
item.description: Underwhelming public responses in the wake of the alleged attack on an Invasion Day rally in Perth leave First Nations people across Australia feeling their "pain matters less".

item.title: Woman found outside Woodlands house with life-threatening injuries
item.description: A 44-year-old woman is rushed to hospital with life-threatening injuries after allegedly being stabbed at a home in suburban Perth overnight.

item.title: Why Asian countries are joining Trump's Board of Peace
item.description: Analysts say Asian countries such as Indonesia and Vietnam have signalled support for US President Donald Trump's new Board of Peace, not because they expect changes in Gaza, but to gain access to US trade.

item.title: Tyra Banks's 'hot ice cream' went viral. Don't expect to see it called that anymore
item.description: Reviews have said it "tasted like soggy biscuits" and was "a weird sensation to sip through a straw". Taste aside, something bugged me. How can you call something ice cream if it's not iced?

item.title: Mosman Park murder-suicide described as 'heartbreaking' by WA premier
item.description: WA Premier Roger Cook says the deaths of a family of four at their Perth home in an apparent murder-suicide is both "heartbreaking" and "unimaginable".

item.title: Myanmar election won by military-backed party in widely condemned poll marred by violence
item.description: The military's political party wins the vote in a result regarded as a forgone conclusion, with critics arguing threats and violence forced people to the ballot box in a country wracked by civil war.

item.title: Why is my migraine worse in summer?
item.description: For people with migraine, summer can be a double-edged sword. You may be able to relax but glare, heat, and changes to sleeping and diet can make attacks more likely or more severe.

item.title: Cricket NSW announces coach Greg Shipperd sacked from state, Sydney Sixers roles
item.description: Legendary cricket coach Greg Shipperd is sacked from his dual state and BBL roles in a major shake-up at Cricket NSW.

item.title: Niels Vink wins Australian Open quad wheelchair singles title
item.description: Paying tribute to his long-time mentor, Niels Vink claims the Australian Open quad wheelchair singles title for the first time.

item.title: Former PM Kevin Rudd says he declined Epstein invitation after latest document dump
item.description: The newly released Epstein documents show the New York sex offender sought a wide-ranging network of political and financial contacts, including former Australian prime minister Kevin Rudd.

item.title: Man accused of posing as talent agent to lure young actors into sex acts granted bail
item.description: The 57-year-old told a Sydney court he posed as a Disney executive because he was "lonely" but only ever shouted people coffee or dinners.

item.title: Rybakina takes down Sabalenka in stunning Australian Open final
item.description: Elena Rybakina wins the Australian Open with a stunning three-set victory over world number one Aryna Sabalenka, who loses in the final for the second straight year.

item.title: England cricketer Harry Brook says he lied about New Zealand nightclub incident to protect teammates
item.description: England's ODI and T20 captain Harry Brook issues a statement admitting he lied over the nightclub incident on his side's tour of New Zealand last year, saying other teammates were present when he was hit by a bouncer.

item.title: Venezuela announces amnesty bill that could lead to mass release of political prisoners
item.description: The government did not release the text of the bill on Friday, leaving it unclear who will qualify for release.

item.title: Pat Cummins ruled out of T20 World Cup as Steve Smith snubbed despite strong form
item.description: Pat Cummins will miss the T20 World Cup after failing to recover from his back injury, while Steve Smith, fresh from a blistering BBL cameo, isn't named in Australia's final 15-man squad.

item.title: Elena Rybakina's Australian Open final win over Aryna Sabalenka proves she's no one-hit wonder
item.description: A consistent and composed Elena Rybakina claims her maiden Australian Open title by beating world number one Aryna Sabalenka in a thriller three years after her breakout Wimbledon win.

item.title: Israeli strikes in Gaza kill at least 30 Palestinians in one of deadliest days since ceasefire
item.description: Israeli strikes have killed at least 30 Palestinians, marking one of the highest death tolls since the ceasefire last October aimed at stopping the fighting.

item.title: Separatists kill 33 people in multiple attacks across Pakistan's south-west as 92 assailants also killed
item.description: Separatists from Pakistan's Balochistan province claimed responsibility for nearly a dozen coordinated attacks across southern Pakistan.

item.title: Sprinklers made Australia green. But what happens when the water runs out?
item.description: Billions of litres of water are sprayed onto household gardens every day during summer, allowing cities to stay green. Now water is running low. Has the sprinkler had its day?

item.title: Hard Quiz: Come on trivia titans, it's time to show me what you've got
item.description: I love that you just keep coming back for more humiliating defeat.

item.title: Who is Stephen Miller? Donald Trump's powerful right hand and immigration policy architect
item.description: From a young age, Stephen Miller was campaigning for ideas that were extremely conservative and extremely strange for a teenager from California. Now, he's running Donald Trump's immigration agenda.

item.title: Woman hospitalised after Juniper prescribes weight-loss drugs her GP refused
item.description: Claire Munch says she was hospitalised with an eating disorder after a telehealth provider approved weight-loss drugs her GP had refused — and that even after she complained, she was later sent marketing promotions.

item.title: How Olympian Michael Klim reinvented himself and his definition of success after muscle-wasting disease CIDP
item.description: Olympian Michael Klim forged his reputation on strength and athleticism. But after being blindsided by an incurable muscle-wasting disease, he was forced to reinvent himself.

item.title: Pakistan claims T20 World Cup warm-up series with 90-run thrashing of Australia
item.description: Pakistan thrashes Australia by 90 runs to claim an unassailable 2-0 series lead in the T20 World Cup warm-up series in Lahore.

item.title: The young Australian who says he is the president of his own European country
item.description: Daniel Jackson claims to be the youngest president in the world. The problem is that no other countries recognise him.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka admits Elena Rybakina handled pressure moment better in Australian Open final
item.description: After going down to Elena Rybakina in a tense encounter, world number one Aryna Sabalenka admits there was a point at which she lost control of the Australian Open final.

item.title: Australian summers to experience more 50C days as heatwaves intensify, experts say
item.description: Heatwaves are becoming longer, more frequent and more intense with multiple days of 50C looking more likely.

item.title: The surprising history behind the Australian Open men's singles trophy
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic go head-to-head today in the men's singles final. Not many people know they are competing for a trophy based on an Ancient Roman artefact.

item.title: Sabalenka done with tennis for a bit and Nadal picks between Alcaraz and Djokovic — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka doesn't "want to think about tennis" after another brutal loss in the women's final and Rafael Nadal picks his men's champion. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Leon Ford and Celia Pacquola show why it's always the reluctant dads who need pets most in Dog Park
item.description: In the new cathartic drama/comedy starring Leon Ford and Celia Pacquola, dogs are the answer to everything.

item.title: Algal bloom brings 'sense of grief' to parts of Yorke Peninsula
item.description: While Adelaide is largely having a reprieve from the algal bloom, it is a different story on the south-west tip of the Yorke Peninsula with locals reporting fish kills and discoloured water.

item.title: Boxing prodigy Ciara Storch punching above her weight on world stage
item.description: The young boxing champion from Dysart in central Queensland has already won more medals she can safely put around her neck, and says she's proud her success has elevated boxing's popularity in her hometown.

item.title: New Epstein documents reveal details about his friendship with former prince Andrew
item.description: The royal family faces a fresh round of embarrassment after the latest tranche of Epstein files reveal unsavoury details about the convicted sex offender's relationship with Andrew.

item.title: Author Shailee Thompson merges horror and romance in debut novel
item.description: Debut author Shailee Thompson's new novel How to Kill a Guy in Ten Dates follows cinephile Jamie Prescott, who has to rely on her extensive knowledge of what not to do in a slasher situation when a speed-dating event she attends turns deadly.

item.title: Tasty lunch-box recipes to make the back-to-school weeks easier
item.description: As kids head back into classrooms, we've put together some recipes to help their school lunch boxes come home empty.

item.title: End of era for iconic NSW mid-north coast attraction Timbertown
item.description: Thousands of tourists and students on school excursions passed through the doors of the heritage village to get an idea of what life was like for Australia's colonial-era timber-getters.

item.title: US judge orders Liam Conejo Ramos, 5, and father released from ICE detention
item.description: A US judge orders a five-year-old boy and his father to be released from immigration detention after their arrest in Minnesota last month.

item.title: Rockhampton gathers for walk against violence after alleged rape of female runner
item.description: The Rockhampton community comes together in a show of emotional support after a young woman was allegedly sexually assaulted and nearly drowned by a stranger on a walking track.

item.title: Liberal frontbenchers dismiss prospect of imminent challenge to Sussan Ley
item.description: Shadow treasurer Ted O'Brien says it is his "assumption" that Liberal frontbencher Angus Taylor still supports Sussan Ley, despite days of speculation that he's planning to challenge for the leadership.

item.title: Nico Antic, 12yo shark attack victim, honoured with paddle-out at North Bondi
item.description: Hundreds of paddle boarders and others journey into the waves of North Bondi to pay tribute to 12-year-old shark victim Nico Antic.

item.title: Trump administration eyes US Pacific territories as it moves towards deep-sea mining
item.description: A Trump administration push to begin deep-sea mining is gathering momentum — and stirring alarm in United States Pacific territories.

item.title: How to unlock your home's history with patience, a little detective work and the internet
item.description: When Billy Harraway-Jones dug into the history of his family home, he discovered a saga of courtship and marriage in a new world, and of life and death on the Australian goldfields.

item.title: Australian Open 2026 final: Carlos Alcaraz, Novak Djokovic meet in titanic battle of generational greats
item.description: More tennis history will go on the line when Novak Djokovic and Carlos Alcaraz clash in an Australian Open final of the highest stakes.

item.title: A summer of extremes unfolded across Western Australia in January 2026 — see the photos
item.description: From bushfires and chaotic scenes, to moments of serenity, January 2026 captured Western Australia in all its extremes.

item.title: A 'chia seed' trend on TikTok promotes a 'quick fix' to weight loss, but is it safe?
item.description: The health benefits of chia seeds have been well publicised, but health and internet experts are urging people to not believe everything you see on social media.

item.title: Darwin mayor throws support behind 21-storey civic centre, with current building to be demolished
item.description: A future landmark of Darwin's CBD is extending skyward, as senior Darwin council figures rebuff concerns from within council that its finances could be affected.

item.title: Four teenage boys credited with saving three swept out by rip at Tasmanian beach
item.description: Police have praised the efforts of four teenage boys who helped three other young people swept out by a rip at a Tasmanian beach, with a dad saying his son was probably "30 seconds from drowning".

item.title: Risso's and pantropical spotted dolphins seen off Port Macquarie
item.description: Deepwater dolphin species make a rare appearance on the NSW Mid North Coast, delighting scientists and marine wildlife enthusiasts.

item.title: Inside the brand strategy behind the Beckham family drama — and who controls the narrative now
item.description: In a modern crisis, experts say control doesn't always come from speaking louder — but from knowing when, where and how briefly to speak at all.

item.title: The Australian national anthem is already sung at most NT schools. So, what is the new mandate really about?
item.description: The NT government's national anthem mandate in public schools made headlines this week — but little will be changing on the ground.

item.title: Half of Adelaide University's Magill campus to be sold for housing, retirement units, aged care
item.description: South Australia's premier announces the future of Adelaide University's Magill campus, which sits on the boundary of two marginal Liberal-held electorates.

item.title: 'One minute it was daylight, the next minute it was black' — massive dust storm rolls through outback NSW
item.description: After more than a month without a single drop of rain, residents living in outback NSW saw a wall of red earth roll in. The large dust storm was well over 100 metres high and several kilometres wide.

item.title: Margaret Pink's fantastic plastic empire spans 57 years, now she's giving back through Tupperware
item.description: Tupperware parties opened the doors for rural women, bridging social isolation and creating careers. Decades on, this colourful plastic ware is still making a difference.

item.title: Red dust storm rolls through Broken Hill, outback NSW
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Is it still profitable to be a landlord?
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Australian Open champion Elena Rybakina eyeing more success after victory over Aryna Sabalenka
item.description: Newly-crowned Australian Open champion Elena Rybakina isn't content with a second grand slam title following a rampant run through the Melbourne Park draw.

item.title: Queensland rebate scheme used to purchase hundreds of potentially illegal e-bikes and e-scooters, audit finds
item.description: Hundreds of illegal, or potentially illegal e-bikes and e-scooters, were purchased under a state government rebate scheme, according to an internal audit that dates back to before the 2024 Queensland election.

item.title: Lily Allen has made a huge comeback — soon she'll be in Australia
item.description: The British singer made her triumphant return to the annual countdown with two tracks from her latest album West End Girl.

item.title: 'Job finished' for Carlos Alcaraz as he wins first Australian Open
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz is the youngest man to complete the career Grand Slam, beating 24-time major winner Novak Djokovic in the Australian Open final.

item.title: Matildas legend Sarah Walsh says South Korea boycott would be 'devastating' for Asian Cup
item.description: Asian Cup organisers say they are hopeful the South Korean women's team will partake in next month's tournament despite threats of a boycott due to "harsh and unreasonable conditions" under the nation's federation.

item.title: Alex Volkanovski retains featherweight championship with decision victory over Diego Lopes at UFC 325
item.description: Alex Volkanovski's win over Diego Lopes at UFC 325 was enough to retain the world featherweight title and give Australia's greatest ever MMA fighter and his fans exactly what they were looking for.

item.title: Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq dismisses Australia's Cameron Green's gesture about his action in second T20I
item.description: Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq responds after Cameron Green appeared to mimic his action in Australia's comprehensive T20 loss in Lahore.

item.title: People with special connection to Fremantle Traffic Bridge bid farewell before reconstruction
item.description: Eighty people with a special connection to the Fremantle Traffic Bridge, including two people who were born on it, are invited to cross the 86-year-old structure before it is demolished and rebuilt.

item.title: The Grammys are on Monday morning — here's how to watch and who to look out for
item.description: From Kendrick Lamar to Lady Gaga, here are all the nominees and performers to look out for at the Grammys this year.

item.title: Clive Palmer rejects Steve Bannon influence claim in latest Epstein files
item.description: Clive Palmer denies newly surfaced claims that his 2019 federal election campaign was influenced by a senior advisor to US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Carlos Alcaraz has his never-before moment by beating Novak Djokovic in his own house
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz has defeated Novak Djokovic in a pulsating Australian Open final, becoming the youngest man with a career Grand Slam in the process.

item.title: Novak Djokovic drops retirement hint, suggesting 2026 could be his final Australian Open
item.description: He did not go into detail on what he meant, nor did he confirm a plan to retire this year, but he chose his words carefully on centre court.

item.title: Preparations underway at Gaza's Rafah crossing a day before Israel says travel will resume
item.description: Although Gaza has four other border crossings, they are shared with Israel, and many Palestinians see Rafah as their gateway to the world.

item.title: Victorian Police launch five-day search in national park for fugitive Dezi Freeman
item.description: Victoria Police will spend five days scouring a remote section of Mount Buffalo National Park in the state's north-east as part of a renewed search for fugitive Dezi Freeman.

item.title: This week in history quiz, February 2: Can you ace our history test?
item.description: Which musician narrowly avoided the plane crash that killed Buddy Holly? And who was the man behind Mark Twain?

item.title: Where in your home is best to set up a work space?
item.description: From garages to cupboards, we asked experts on things to consider before you choose where to set up a home office.

item.title: Bondi terror attack survivors recount moments of horror and heroism
item.description: Survivors, grieving family members and those who ran towards danger describe, in their own words, what they witnessed as the Bondi attack unfolded.

item.title: Property prices expected to slow as forecast RBA interest rate hike dampens growth
item.description: Property prices rose across the country in January, but analysts expect the pace of growth to slow as forecast rate hikes put off prospective buyers.

item.title: The economy should be the focus but Coalition incompetence is a gift to Labor
item.description: The trip to the tennis is a sign of the PM's own sense of confidence. It's a move that is only made by a man who clearly has his mojo back.

item.title: Unnecessary interest rate cuts derailed the national housing affordability project
item.description: The great unspoken truth about central banking and monetary policy is that while it's aimed at consumer prices, its most direct impact is on house prices, which are arguably the most important prices of all.

item.title: David Littleproud to survive spill, but Sussan Ley’s future uncertain
item.description: Leadership speculation has engulfed both the Liberal and National parties since the minor party walked away from the Coalition agreement two weeks ago.

item.title: Inside Donald Trump's ICE detention centre boom — and the families caught in the crackdown
item.description: The Trump administration's rapid expansion of ICE detention centres has led to inhumane conditions, record deaths and allegations of abuse, civil rights watchdogs warn.

item.title: Snowy 2.0 defends timeline as it launches new $75 million machine amid cost blowout review
item.description: The boss of Snowy Hydro says the project is on track to deliver power by the end of 2028, as it launches a new $75 million tunnel-boring machine designed to make up for lost time.

item.title: Novak Djokovic praises Carlos Alcaraz after Spaniard wins first Australian Open title
item.description: Despite the hollow feeling of defeat, 24-time major winner Novak Djokovic heaps praise on Carlos Alcaraz following the Spaniard's history-making Australian Open victory.

item.title: Alcaraz and Djokovic thrill Rafa and a 'boring' heckle delights Rod Laver Arena — quick hits from the Australian Open men's final
item.description: Rafael Nadal gives his seal of approval and Novak Djokovic collects the one trophy missing from his cabinet as his Melbourne Park fortunes flip. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: 'Cynical and targeted' Russian strike on Ukrainian bus kills 12
item.description: A series of attacks across Ukraine comes ahead of US-brokered trilateral talks between Ukraine and Russia set for the coming week.

item.title: Grandparents risking their financial security to help support adult children in Family Court matters
item.description: Many grandparents are parting with hundreds of thousands of dollars to help support their adult children through family law matters, in turn impacting their own financial security in retirement.

item.title: Can your dog read your next move? These are the cues they use
item.description: Your dog is constantly reading you and using it to their advantage. These are the cues they use to foresee your next move.

item.title: Queensland to be hit by storms after heatwave, flooding up north could last for weeks
item.description: Flooding in North Queensland could last for several more weeks, and while the heatwave that has blanketed parts of the state comes to an end, it will be replaced by storms and severe winds.
